main_text:
Thematic Exposition of Levinas’ Philosophy
2. Thematic Exposition of Levinas’ Philosophy

This entry will follow Levinas’ career chronologically, as his
concepts evolve. In what follows, we will emphasize the following
arguments and themes: (1) why Levinas’ is a unique first
philosophy; (2) how he developed his investigation of the lived
conditions of possibility of our concern with ethical reasoning; and
(3) the originality of his adaptation of phenomenology and his
existentialist hermeneutics of pre-intentional embodied
intersubjectivity. In this entry, attention is focused throughout to
the contribution of commentators, with a view to providing a gateway
to recent secondary literature.
